alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 9:24PM EST until February 18 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Estill and Powell. In southeast Kentucky, Breathitt, Clay, Jackson, Lee, Owsley and Wolfe. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 923 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Irvine, Beattyville, McKee, Booneville, Fincastle, Ravenna, Old Orchard, Arvel, Banford, Leighton, Earnestville, Evelyn, Yellow Rock, Wind Cave, Willow Shoals, Wild Dog, Cressmont, New Zion, Lakes and Alumbaugh.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
